13  package net.sf.oval.test.validator;
14  
15  import java.lang.reflect.Field;
16  import java.util.ArrayList;
17  import java.util.Arrays;
18  import java.util.HashMap;
19  import java.util.HashSet;
20  import java.util.List;
21  import java.util.Map;
22  import java.util.Set;
23  
24  import junit.framework.TestCase;
25  import net.sf.oval.ConstraintViolation;
26  import net.sf.oval.Validator;
27  import net.sf.oval.constraint.AssertValid;
28  import net.sf.oval.constraint.Length;
29  import net.sf.oval.constraint.MatchPattern;
30  import net.sf.oval.constraint.NotEmpty;
31  import net.sf.oval.constraint.NotNull;
32  
33  /**
34   * @author Sebastian Thomschke
35   */
36  public class AssertValidTest extends TestCase
37  {
38  	protected static class Address
39  	{
40  		@NotNull
41  		public String street;
42  
43  		@NotNull
44  		public String city;
45  
46  		@NotNull
47  		@Length(max = 6)
48  		@NotEmpty
49  		@MatchPattern(pattern = "^[0-9]*$")
50  		public String zipCode;
51  
52  		@AssertValid(message = "ASSERT_VALID")
53  		public Person contact;
54  	}
55  
56  	protected static class Person
57  	{
58  		@NotNull
59  		public String firstName;
60  
61  		@NotNull
62  		public String lastName;
63  
64  		@AssertValid(message = "ASSERT_VALID")
65  		public Address homeAddress;
66  
67  		@AssertValid(message = "ASSERT_VALID")
68  		public List<Address> otherAddresses1;
69  
70  		@AssertValid(message = "ASSERT_VALID", requireValidElements = false)
71  		public Set<Address> otherAddresses2;
72  
73  		@AssertValid(message = "ASSERT_VALID", requireValidElements = true)
74  		public Set<Address> otherAddresses3;
75  
76  	}
77  
78  	protected static class Registry
79  	{
80  		@AssertValid
81  		public List<Address[]> addressClusters;
82  
83  		@AssertValid
84  		public Map<String, List<Person>> personsByCity;
85  
86  		@AssertValid
87  		public Map<String, Map<String, Address[]>> addressesByCityAndStreet;
88  	}
89  
90  	public void testValidateFieldValue() throws SecurityException, NoSuchFieldException
91  	{
92  		final Validator validator = new Validator();
93  
94  		final Person p = new Person();
95  		final Field fieldHomeAddress = p.getClass().getDeclaredField("homeAddress");
96  		final Address a = new Address();
97  
98  		final List<ConstraintViolation> violations = validator.validateFieldValue(p, fieldHomeAddress, a);
99  		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
100 		assertEquals("ASSERT_VALID", violations.get(0).getMessage());
101 		assertEquals(a, violations.get(0).getInvalidValue());
102 
103 		a.street = "The Street";
104 		a.city = "The City";
105 		a.zipCode = "12345";
106 		assertEquals(0, validator.validateFieldValue(p, fieldHomeAddress, a).size());
107 	}
108 
109 	public void testCollectionValues()
110 	{
111 		final Validator validator = new Validator();
112 
113 		final Person p = new Person();
114 		p.firstName = "John";
115 		p.lastName = "Doe";
116 		p.otherAddresses1 = new ArrayList<Address>();
117 		p.otherAddresses2 = new HashSet<Address>();
118 		p.otherAddresses3 = new HashSet<Address>();
119 
120 		final Address a = new Address();
121 		a.street = "The Street";
122 		a.city = "The City";
123 		a.zipCode = null;
124 		assertEquals(1, validator.validate(a).size());
125 
126 		p.otherAddresses1.add(a);
127 		assertEquals(1, validator.validate(p).size());
128 
129 		p.otherAddresses1.remove(a);
130 		p.otherAddresses2.add(a);
131 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(p).size());
132 
133 		p.otherAddresses3.add(a);
134 		assertEquals(1, validator.validate(p).size());
135 	}
136 
137 	public void testRecursion()
138 	{
139 		final Validator validator = new Validator();
140 
141 		final Registry registry = new Registry();
142 
143 		// nulled collections and maps are valid
144 		assertTrue(validator.validate(registry).size() == 0);
145 
146 		registry.addressesByCityAndStreet = new HashMap<String, Map<String, Address[]>>();
147 		registry.addressClusters = new ArrayList<Address[]>();
148 		registry.personsByCity = new HashMap<String, List<Person>>();
149 
150 		// empty collections and maps are valid
151 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(registry).size());
152 
153 		final Person invalidPerson1 = new Person();
154 		final Person invalidPerson2 = new Person();
155 
156 		// map with an empty list is valid
157 		registry.personsByCity.put("city1", new ArrayList<Person>());
158 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(registry).size());
159 
160 		registry.personsByCity.put("city1", Arrays.asList(new Person[]{invalidPerson1}));
161 		assertEquals(1, validator.validate(registry).size());
162 
163 		registry.personsByCity.put("city2", Arrays.asList(new Person[]{invalidPerson2}));
164 		assertEquals(2, validator.validate(registry).size());
165 
166 		registry.personsByCity.clear();
167 		registry.personsByCity.put("city1", Arrays.asList(new Person[]{invalidPerson1, invalidPerson1, invalidPerson2,
168 				invalidPerson2}));
169 		// still only two since invalidPerson1 and invalidPerson2 have already been validated
170 		assertEquals(2, validator.validate(registry).size());
171 
172 		registry.personsByCity.clear();
173 
174 		// list with an array with empty elements is valid
175 		registry.addressClusters.add(new Address[10]);
176 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(registry).size());
177 
178 		final Address invalidAddress1 = new Address();
179 		final Address invalidAddress2 = new Address();
180 
181 		registry.addressClusters.add(new Address[10]);
182 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(registry).size());
183 
184 		registry.addressClusters.add(new Address[]{invalidAddress1, invalidAddress2, invalidAddress1, invalidAddress2});
185 		// still only two since invalidPerson1 and invalidPerson2 have already been validated
186 		assertEquals(2, validator.validate(registry).size());
187 
188 		registry.addressClusters.clear();
189 
190 		// map with an entry with an empty map is valid
191 		registry.addressesByCityAndStreet.put("city1", new HashMap<String, Address[]>());
192 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(registry).size());
193 
194 		// map with an entry with an map with an element with an empty array is valid
195 		registry.addressesByCityAndStreet.get("city1").put("street1", new Address[0]);
196 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(registry).size());
197 
198 		registry.addressesByCityAndStreet.get("city1").put("street1",
199 				new Address[]{invalidAddress1, invalidAddress1, invalidAddress2, invalidAddress2});
200 		// still only two since invalidAddress1 and invalidAddress2 have already been validated
201 		assertEquals(2, validator.validate(registry).size());
202 	}
203 
204 	public void testScalarValues()
205 	{
206 		final Validator validator = new Validator();
207 
208 		final Person p = new Person();
209 		p.firstName = "John";
210 		p.lastName = "Doe";
211 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(p).size());
212 
213 		final Address a = new Address();
214 		a.street = "The Street";
215 		a.city = "The City";
216 		a.zipCode = "12345";
217 		assertEquals(0, validator.validate(a).size());
218 
219 		// make the address invalid
220 		a.zipCode = null;
221 		assertEquals(1, validator.validate(a).size());
222 
223 		// associate the invalid address with the person check the person for validity
224 		p.homeAddress = a;
225 		List<ConstraintViolation> violations = validator.validate(p);
226 		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
227 		assertEquals("ASSERT_VALID", violations.get(0).getMessage());
228 
229 		// test circular dependencies
230 		a.contact = p;
231 		violations = validator.validate(p);
232 		assertEquals(1, violations.size());
233 		assertEquals("ASSERT_VALID", violations.get(0).getMessage());
234 	}
235 }
